rightscale_api_token.Description: API token used to authenticate the RightScale API requests

rightscale_project_id.Description: ID of RightScale project used to provision resources

parameters.Description: main definition parameter values in order of declaration

kind.Description:
Entities have a kind and a value.
  * The kind for a JSON value corresponds to the JSON type name ('string',
  'number', 'bool', 'null', 'array', 'object')
  * The kind for a resource declaration is 'declaration'
  * The kind for a resource collection is 'collection'

value.Description:
Entities have a kind and a value.
  * The value for entities of kind 'string', 'number', 'bool', 'null', 'array'
    or 'object' is the JSON reprensentation of the underlying value.
  * The value for a resource collection is a JSON object with the following keys:
      - 'namespace' contains a string representing the collection namespace (e.g. 'rs')
      - 'type' contains a string representing the collection type (e.g. 'servers')
      - 'hrefs' contains an arry of strings representing the hrefs of the resources in the collection
      - 'details' contains an array of hashes representing the resource attributes
  * The value for a resource declaration is a JSON object with the following keys:
      - 'namespace' contains a string representing the declaration namespace (e.g. 'rs')
      - 'type' contains a string reprensenting the declaration type (e.g. 'servers')
      - 'fields' contains a hash reprensenting the data needed to create the resource
      - 'dependencies' contains an array that lists names of references this declaration depends on

source.Description: process source code, must contain a definition called 'main'

resource_group_href.Description: ID of the Windows Azure Resource Group attached to the deployment

server_tag_scope.Description: routing scope for tags for servers in the deployment

associate_public_ip_address.Description: Specify whether or not you want a public IP assigned when this Instance is launched. Only applies to Network-enabled Instances. If this is not specified, it will default to true.

cloud_href.Description: The ID of the instance cloud

cloud_specific_attributes.Description: Cloud specific attributes that have no generic rightscale abstraction

admin_username.Description: The user that will be granted administrative privileges. Supported by AzureRM cloud only. For more information, review the documentation.

automatic_instance_store_mapping.Description: A flag indicating whether instance store mapping should be enabled. Not supported in all Clouds.

availability_set.Description: Availability set for raw instance. Supported by Azure v2 cloud only.

create_boot_volume.Description: If enabled, the instance will launch into volume storage. Otherwise, it will boot to local storage.

create_default_port_forwarding_rules.Description: Automatically create default port forwarding rules (enabled by default). Supported by Azure cloud only.

delete_boot_volume.Description: If enabled, the associated volume will be deleted when the instance is terminated.

disk_gb.Description: The size of root disk. Supported by UCA cloud only.

ebs_optimized.Description: Whether the instance is able to connect to IOPS-enabled volumes.

iam_instance_profile.Description: The name or ARN of the IAM Instance Profile (IIP) to associate with the instance (Amazon only)

keep_alive_id.Description: The id of keep alive. Supported by UCA cloud only.

keep_alive_url.Description: he ulr of keep alive. Supported by UCA cloud only.

local_ssd_count.Description: Additional local SSDs. Supported by GCE cloud only

local_ssd_interface.Description: The type of SSD(s) to be created. Supported by GCE cloud only

max_spot_price.Description: Specify the max spot price you will pay for. Required when 'pricing_type' is 'spot'. Only applies to clouds which support spot-pricing and when 'spot' is chosen as the 'pricing_type'. Should be a Float value >= 0.001, eg: 0.095, 0.123, 1.23, etc...

memory_mb.Description: The size of instance memory. Supported by UCA cloud only.

metadata.Description: Extra data used for configuration, in query string format.

num_cores.Description: The number of instance cores. Supported by UCA cloud only.

placement_tenancy.Description: The tenancy of the server you want to launch. A server with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC.

preemptible.Description: Launch a preemptible instance. A preemptible instance costs much less, but lasts only 24 hours. It can be terminated sooner due to system demands. Supported by GCE cloud only.

pricing_type.Description: Specify whether or not you want to utilize 'fixed' (on-demand) or 'spot' pricing. Defaults to 'fixed' and only applies to clouds which support spot instances. Can only be set on when creating a new Instance, Server, or ServerArray, or when updating a Server or ServerArray's next_instance.WARNING: By using spot pricing, you acknowledge that your instance/server/array may not be able to be launched (and arrays may be unable to grow) as newly launched instances might be stuck in bidding, and/or existing instances may be terminated at any time, due to the cloud's spot pricing changes and availability.

root_volume_performance.Description: The number of IOPS (I/O Operations Per Second) this root volume should support. Only available on clouds supporting performance provisioning.

root_volume_size.Description: The size for root disk. Not supported in all Clouds.

root_volume_type_uid.Description: The type of root volume for instance. Only available on clouds supporting root volume type.

service_account.Description: Email of service account for instance. Scope will default to cloud-platform. Supported by GCE cloud only.

datacenter_href.Description: The ID of the instance datacenter

deployment_href.Description: The ID of the instance deployment

image_href.Description: The ID of the instance image

inputs.Description: Inputs associated with an instance when incarnated from a server or server array

instance_type_href.Description: The ID of the instance type

ip_forwarding_enabled.Description: Allows this Instance to send and receive network traffic when the source and destination IP addresses do not match the IP address of this Instance.

kernel_image_href.Description: The ID of the instance kernel image.

locked.Description: whether instance is locked, a locked instance cannot be terminated or deleted

placement_group_href.Description: The placement group to launch the instance in. Not supported by all clouds & instance types.

private_ip_address.Description: The private ip address for the instance

ramdisk_image_href.Description: The ID of the ramdisk image

security_group_hrefs.Description: The IDs of the security groups

server_template_href.Description: The ID of the server template.

ssh_key_href.Description: The ID of the SSH key to use

subnet_hrefs.Description: The IDs of the instance subnets

user_data.Description: User data that RightScale automatically passes to your instance at boot time

cidr_block.Description: range of IP addresses for network, this parameter is required for Amazon clouds

cloud_href.Description: ID of cloud to create network in

deployment_href.Description: Optional href of deployment that owns the network.

instance_tenancy.Description: launch policy for AWS instances in the network. Specify 'dedicated' to force all instances to be launched as 'dedicated'.

route_table_href.Description: sets the default route table for this network

cloud_href.Description: ID of cloud in which to create network gateway

next_hop_href.Description: The href of the Route's next hop. Required if 'next_hop_type' is 'instance', 'network_interface', or 'network_gateway'. Not allowed otherwise.

next_hop_ip.Description: The IP Address of the Route's next hop. Required if 'next_hop_type' is 'ip_string'. Not allowed otherwise.

next_hop_type.Description: The route next hop type.  Options are 'instance', 'network_interface', 'network_gateway', 'ip_string', and 'url'

next_hop_url.Description: The URL of the Route's next hop. Required if 'next_hop_type' is 'url'. Not allowed otherwise.

route_table_href.Description: Href of route table in which to create new route

cloud_href.Description: Href of cloud in which to create route table

network_href.Description: Href of network in which to create route table

cloud_href.Description: href of the security group cloud

deployment_href.Description: Optional href of deployment that owns the security group

network_href.Description: href of the network to create the security group in

cidr_ips.Description: An IP address range in CIDR notation. Required if source_type is 'cidr'. Conflicts with 'group_name' and 'group_owner'

direction.Description: Direction of traffic.  Options are 'ingress' or 'egress.'

group_name.Description: Name of source Security Group. Required if source_type is 'group'.  Conflicts with 'cidr_ips'.

group_owner.Description: Owner of source Security Group. Required if source_type is 'group'. Conflicts with 'cidr_ips'.

priority.Description: Lower takes precedence. Supported by security group rules created in Microsoft Azure only.

protocol.Description: Protocol to filter on.  Options are 'tcp', 'udp', 'icmp' and 'all'.

end_port.Description: End of port range (inclusive). Required if protocol is 'tcp' or 'udp'.

icmp_code.Description: ICMP code. Required if protocol is 'icmp'.

icmp_type.Description: ICMP type. Required if protocol is 'icmp'.

start_port.Description: Start of port range (inclusive). Required if protocol is 'tcp' or 'udp'.

source_type.Description: Source type. May be a CIDR block or another Security Group. Options are 'cidr_ips' or 'group'.

deployment_href.Description: ID of deployment in which to create server

associate_public_ip_address.Description: Specify whether or not you want a public IP assigned when this Instance is launched. Only applies to Network-enabled Instances. If this is not specified, it will default to true.

locked.Description: whether instance is locked, a locked instance cannot be terminated or deleted

ramdisk_image_href.Description: The ID of the ramdisk image

security_group_hrefs.Description: The IDs of the security groups

server_template_href.Description: The ID of the server template.

ssh_key_href.Description: The ID of the SSH key to use

subnet_hrefs.Description: The IDs of the instance subnets

user_data.Description: User data that RightScale automatically passes to your instance at boot time

optimized.Description: A flag indicating whether Instances of this Server should be optimized for high-performance volumes (e.g. Volumes supporting a specified number of IOPS). Not supported in all Clouds.

tags.Description: Tags to apply to server and associated instance

array_type.Description: The array type for the Server Array.

datacenter_href.Description: The href of the Datacenter / Zone.

deployment_href.Description: ID of deployment in which to create server_array

alert_specific_params.Description: Alert based server array params, required if 'array_type' is 'alert'

decision_threshold.Description: The percentage of servers that must agree in order to trigger an alert before an action is taken.

voters_tag_predicate.Description: The Voters Tag that RightScale will use in order to determine when to scale up/down.

max_count.Description: The maximum number of servers that can be operational at the same time in the server array.

min_count.Description: The minimum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array.

resize_calm_time.Description: The time (in minutes) on how long you want to wait before you repeat another action.

resize_down_by.Description: The number of servers to scale down by.

resize_up_by.Description: The number of servers to scale up by.

collect_audit_entries.Description: The audit SQS queue that will store audit entries.

algorithm.Description: The algorithm that defines how an item's age will be determined, either by the average age or max (oldest) age.

max_age.Description: The threshold (in seconds) before a resize action occurs on the server array.

regexp.Description: The regexp that helps the system determine an item's "age" in the queue. Example: created_at: (\d\d\d\d-\d\d-\d\d \d\d:\d\d:\d\d UTC)

items_per_instance.Description: Defines the ratio of worker instances per items in the queue. Example: If there are 50 items in the queue and "Items per instance" is set to 10, the server array will resize to 5 worker instances (50/10). Default = 1

day.Description: Specifies the day when an alert-based array resizes.

max_count.Description: The maximum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array. NOTE: Any changes that are made to the min/max count in the server array schedule will overwrite the array's default min/max count settings.

min_count.Description: The minimum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array. NOTE: Any changes that are made to the min/max count in the server array schedule will overwrite the array's default min/max count settings.

time.Description: Specifies the time when an alert-based array resizes.

associate_public_ip_address.Description: Specify whether or not you want a public IP assigned when this Instance is launched. Only applies to Network-enabled Instances. If this is not specified, it will default to true.

state.Description: The status of the server array. If active, the server array is enabled for scaling actions.

cidr_block.Description: range of IP addresses for subnet, this parameter is required for Amazon clouds

cloud_href.Description: Href of cloud resource

is_default.Description: whether the subnet is the network default subnet

state.Description: indicates whether subnet is pending, available etc.

name.Description: name of credential, uses partial match

view.Description: Filter at api level for the view: 'default' or 'sensitive' are valid options

cloud_href.Description: Href of datacenter cloud resource

resource_uid.Description: cloud ID - if this filter is set additional retry logic will fire to allow for cloud resource discovery

description.Description: description of deployment, uses partial match

name.Description: name of deployment, uses partial match

resource_group_href.Description: resource group href to filter on

server_tag_scope.Description: tag routing scope of deployments to filter on, uses partial match

view.Description: Filter at api level for the view: 'default,' 'inputs' or 'inputs_2_0' are valid options

cloud_href.Description: ID of image cloud resource

cpu_architecture.Description: CPU architecture of image, e.g. 'x86_64', uses partial match

description.Description: description of image, uses partial match

image_type.Description: The Image Type to filter on. This will be either "machine", "machine_azure", "ramdisk" or "kernel"

name.Description: name of image, uses partial match

os_platform.Description: The image's operating system to filter on. Examples: Linux or Windows.

resource_uid.Description: cloud ID - if this filter is set additional retry logic will fire to allow for cloud resource discovery

visibility.Description: The visibility of the Image in the cloud to filter on, defaults to 'private.' Options: private, public.

local_ssd_count.Description: Additional local SSDs. Supported by GCE cloud only

local_ssd_interface.Description: The type of SSD(s) to be created. Supported by GCE cloud only

max_spot_price.Description: Specify the max spot price you will pay for. Required when 'pricing_type' is 'spot'. Only applies to clouds which support spot-pricing and when 'spot' is chosen as the 'pricing_type'. Should be a Float value >= 0.001, eg: 0.095, 0.123, 1.23, etc...

memory_mb.Description: The size of instance memory. Supported by UCA cloud only.

metadata.Description: Extra data used for configuration, in query string format.

num_cores.Description: The number of instance cores. Supported by UCA cloud only.

placement_tenancy.Description: The tenancy of the server you want to launch. A server with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC.

preemptible.Description: Launch a preemptible instance. A preemptible instance costs much less, but lasts only 24 hours. It can be terminated sooner due to system demands. Supported by GCE cloud only.

pricing_type.Description: Specify whether or not you want to utilize 'fixed' (on-demand) or 'spot' pricing. Defaults to 'fixed' and only applies to clouds which support spot instances. Can only be set on when creating a new Instance, Server, or ServerArray, or when updating a Server or ServerArray's next_instance.WARNING: By using spot pricing, you acknowledge that your instance/server/array may not be able to be launched (and arrays may be unable to grow) as newly launched instances might be stuck in bidding, and/or existing instances may be terminated at any time, due to the cloud's spot pricing changes and availability.

root_volume_performance.Description: The number of IOPS (I/O Operations Per Second) this root volume should support. Only available on clouds supporting performance provisioning.

root_volume_size.Description: The size for root disk. Not supported in all Clouds.

root_volume_type_uid.Description: The type of root volume for instance. Only available on clouds supporting root volume type.

service_account.Description: Email of service account for instance. Scope will default to cloud-platform. Supported by GCE cloud only.

datacenter_href.Description: The ID of the instance datacenter

deployment_href.Description: The ID of the instance deployment

image_href.Description: The ID of the instance image

inputs.Description: Inputs associated with an instance when incarnated from a server or server array

instance_type_href.Description: The ID of the instance type

ip_forwarding_enabled.Description: Allows this Instance to send and receive network traffic when the source and destination IP addresses do not match the IP address of this Instance.

kernel_image_href.Description: The ID of the instance kernel image.

locked.Description: whether instance is locked, a locked instance cannot be terminated or deleted

placement_group_href.Description: The placement group to launch the instance in. Not supported by all clouds & instance types.

private_ip_address.Description: The private ip address for the instance

ramdisk_image_href.Description: The ID of the ramdisk image

security_group_hrefs.Description: The IDs of the security groups

server_template_href.Description: The ID of the server template.

ssh_key_href.Description: The ID of the SSH key to use

subnet_hrefs.Description: The IDs of the instance subnets

user_data.Description: User data that RightScale automatically passes to your instance at boot time

optimized.Description: A flag indicating whether Instances of this Server should be optimized for high-performance volumes (e.g. Volumes supporting a specified number of IOPS). Not supported in all Clouds.

multi_cloud_image_href.Description: ID of ServerTemplate multi cloud image resource

revision.Description: revision of ServerTemplate, use 0 to match latest non-committed version

cloud_href.Description: ID of the SSH key cloud

name.Description: name of SSH key, uses partial match

resource_uid.Description: cloud ID - if this filter is set additional retry logic will fire to allow for cloud resource discovery

view.Description: Filter at api level for the view: 'default' or 'sensitive' are valid options

cloud_href.Description: ID of the subnet cloud

datacenter_href.Description: Href of the subnet datacenter resource

instance_href.Description: Href of instance resource attached to subnet

name.Description: Name of subnet, uses partial match

network_href.Description: Href of network resource that owns subnet

resource_uid.Description: cloud ID - if this filter is set additional retry logic will fire to allow for cloud resource discovery

visibility.Description: Visibility of the subnet to filter by (private, shared, etc)

cloud_href.Description: ID of the volume cloud

datacenter_href.Description: ID of the volume datacenter resource

deployment_href.Description: ID of deployment resource that owns volume

description.Description: description of volume, uses partial match

name.Description: name of volume, uses partial match

parent_volume_snapshot_href.Description: ID of volume snapshot that volume was created from

resource_uid.Description: cloud ID - if this filter is set additional retry logic will fire to allow for cloud resource discovery

cloud_href.Description: ID of the volume snapshot cloud

deployment_href.Description: ID of deployment resource that owns volume snapshot

description.Description: description of volume snapshot, uses partial match

name.Description: name of volume snapshot, uses partial match

parent_volume_href.Description: ID of volume resource from which volume snapshot was created

resource_uid.Description: cloud ID - if this filter is set additional retry logic will fire to allow for cloud resource discovery

cloud_href.Description: ID of the volume type cloud

name.Description: name of volume type, uses partial match

resource_uid.Description: cloud ID - if this filter is set additional retry logic will fire to allow for cloud resource discovery
